pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:0.4: The sub-chapter on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:0.5: 29. The training rule on receiving an even measure of bean curry
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood with large amounts of bean curry. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.3.1: “‘I will receive almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.5: there are two kinds of bean curry, to be taken with the hand: mung-bean curry and black-gram curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.6: Almsfood should be received with the right proportion of bean curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.7: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.13: if it is any food apart from bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.15: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.16: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.17: if it is by means of his own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.20: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.21: The ninth training rule is finished.
